context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: ISIS 'White Widow' Recruiter Sally Jones Killed With Child in U.S. Airstrike: Reports
context_meta.summary: An infamous British recruiter and propagandist for the Islamic State militant group (ISIS)—known as the “White Widow”—is believed to have been killed in a U.S. airstrike in Syria. Sally Jones, who championed the call for ISIS violence both in Europe and the Middle East on social media, has reportedly been killed with her 12-year-old son Jojo four years after travelling to Syria to join her British husband Junaid Hussain in 2013. British intelligence sources, citing information handed over by the CIA, told the UK’s Sun newspaper that Jones was killed in a predator drone strike near the Syria-Iraq border in June.

context_meta.summary: An infamous British recruiter and propagandist for the Islamic State militant group (ISIS)—known as the “White Widow”—is believed to have been killed in a U.S. airstrike in Syria. Sally Jones, who championed the call for ISIS violence both in Europe and the Middle East on social media, has reportedly been killed with her 12-year-old son Jojo four years after travelling to Syria to join her British husband Junaid Hussain in 2013. British intelligence sources, citing information handed over by the CIA, told the UK’s Sun newspaper that Jones was killed in a predator drone strike near the Syria-Iraq border in June.

text: Wow, I bet that is one family that's really glad to be home!  Captivity couldn't have too awful, though, if they concieved 3 children.

text:
I am discussed at some of these comments. As a U.S. citizen I have lived in Mexico for nine years and now a permanent resident. While living in the U.S. I was mugged twice, my home robbed. I was also held hostage by a crazy guy I went out with a few times. That actually turned into a funny story. I believe the U.S. has a misconception of Mexico. In nine years I've only had one person steal from me. Carol, who I thought was my best friend. She was a North American from Canada.

There are many wonderful people here. The Mexican people I know are hard working and deserve respect. I live in Ajijic, an earthquake could devastate our town. Please don't judge a country you know nothing about.

context_meta.summary: Rubble is all that remains of hundreds of houses rent asunder by the earthquake that struck Mexico in September, leaving owners lodging with relatives or friends, hoping their homes can be rebuilt or they can find new ones.

text: Mexico was in ruins far before the quake.

context_meta.author: Yahoo News
context_meta.title: US to pull out of UNESCO amid Palestinian tensions
context_meta.summary: PARIS (AP) — The United States is pulling out of UNESCO because of what Washington sees as its anti-Israel bias and a need for "fundamental reform" of the U.N. cultural agency.

text: So sad this happened. However, I hate the idea that the media is using these people as pawns, when it comes to the "Poor Me" bit. Yes. They need help. context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: Flooding kills dozens, submerges 16K homes in Vietnam
context_meta.summary: Floods and landslides after a tropical depression have killed at least 37 people, left another 40 missing and damaged homes and crops in northern and central Vietnam, officials said. The disasters injured 21 people and destroyed or damaged more than 1,000 houses, submerged another 16,740 homes and damaged infrastructure and crops in six central and northern provinces, the Vietnam Disaster Management Authority said in a statement Thursday. In the hardest-hit northern province of Hoa Binh, 11 people died and 21 others were missing. The casualties include four families whose houses were buried in a landslide early Thursday while they were sleeping, killing six and leaving another 12 missing, disaster official Quach Viet Hoang said.
